verses.verse: It happened after this,<WH310> that Nahash<WH5176> the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> died,<WH4191> and his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>

David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "I will show<WH6213> kindness<WH2617> to Hanun<WH2586> the son<WH1121> of Nahash,<WH5176> because his father<WH1> showed<WH6213> kindness<WH2617> to me.<WH1732>" So David sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to comfort<WH5162> him concerning his father.<WH1> David<WH1732>'s servants<WH5650> came<WH935> into the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> to Hanun,<WH2586> to comfort him.<WH5162>

But the princes<WH8269> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> said<WH559> to Hanun,<WH2586> "Do you think<WH5869> that David<WH1732> honors<WH3513> your father,<WH1> in that he has sent<WH7971> comforters<WH5162> to you?<WH5650> Haven't his servants come<WH935> to you to search,<WH2713> to overthrow,<WH2015> and to spy out<WH7270> the land?<WH776>"

So Hanun<WH2586> took<WH3947> David<WH1732>'s servants,<WH5650> and shaved<WH1548> them,<WH3772> and cut off their garments<WH4063> in the middle,<WH2677> even to their buttocks,<WH4667> and sent them away.<WH7971>

Then there went<WH3212> certain persons,<WH5046> and told David<WH1732> how the men<WH582> were served.<WH7971> He sent to meet<WH7125> them;<WH582> for the men were greatly<WH3966> ashamed.<WH3637> The king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "Stay<WH3427> at Jericho<WH3405> until your beards<WH2206> have grown,<WH6779> and then return.<WH7725>"

When the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> saw<WH7200> that they had made themselves odious<WH887> to David,<WH1732> Hanun<WH2586> and the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> sent<WH7971> one thousand<WH505> talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> to hire<WH7936> them chariots<WH7393> and horsemen<WH6571> out of Mesopotamia,<WH763> and out of Arammaacah,<WH758> and out of Zobah.<WH6678>

So they hired<WH7936> for themselves thirty<WH7970> - two<WH8147> thousand<WH505> chariots,<WH7393> and the king<WH4428> of Maacah<WH4601> and his people,<WH5971> who came<WH935> and encamped<WH2583> before<WH6440> Medeba.<WH4311> The children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> gathered themselves together<WH622> from their cities,<WH5892> and came<WH935> to battle.<WH4421>
When David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it,<WH7971> he sent Joab,<WH3097> and all the army<WH6635> of the mighty men.<WH1368>

The children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> came out,<WH3318> and put the battle<WH4421> in array<WH6186> at the gate<WH6607> of the city:<WH5892> and the kings<WH4428> who had come<WH935> were by themselves in the field.<WH7704>

Now when Joab<WH3097> saw<WH7200> that the battle<WH4421> was set against him before<WH6440> and behind,<WH268> he chose of<WH977> all the choice<WH977> men of Israel,<WH3478> and put them in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> the Syrians.<WH758>

The rest<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> he committed<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of Abishai<WH52> his brother;<WH251> and they put themselves in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>

He said,<WH559> "If the Syrians<WH758> are too strong<WH2388> for me,<WH8668> then you are to help me;<WH1121> but if the children of Ammon<WH5983> are too strong<WH2388> for you,<WH3467> then I will help you.
Be courageous,<WH2388> and let us be strong<WH2388> for our people,<WH5971> and for the cities<WH5892> of our God.<WH430> May Yahweh<WH3068> do<WH6213> that which seems<WH5869> good to him.<WH2896>"
So Joab<WH3097> and the people<WH5971> who were with him drew near<WH5066> before<WH6440> the Syrians<WH758> to the battle;<WH4421> and they fled<WH5127> before him.<WH6440>

When the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> saw<WH7200> that the Syrians<WH758> had fled,<WH5127> they likewise fled<WH5127> before<WH6440> Abishai<WH52> his brother,<WH251> and entered<WH935> into the city.<WH5892> Then Joab<WH3097> came<WH935> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>

When the Syrians<WH758> saw<WH7200> that they were defeated by Israel,<WH3478> they sent<WH7971> messengers,<WH4397> and drew forth<WH3318> the Syrians<WH758> who were beyond<WH5676> the River,<WH5104> with Shophach<WH7780> the captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> of Hadadezer<WH1928> at their head.<WH6440>

It was told<WH5046> David;<WH1732> and he gathered<WH622> all Israel<WH3478> together,<WH5674> and passed over the Jordan,<WH3383> and came<WH935> on them,<WH6186> and set the battle in array against them.<WH1732> So when David had put the battle<WH4421> in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> the Syrians,<WH758> they fought with him.<WH3898>

The Syrians<WH758> fled<WH5127> before<WH6440> Israel;<WH3478> and David<WH1732> killed<WH2026> of the Syrians<WH758> the men of seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> chariots,<WH7393> and forty<WH705> thousand<WH505> footmen,<WH376> and killed<WH4191> Shophach<WH7780> the captain<WH8269> of the army.<WH6635>

When the servants<WH5650> of Hadadezer<WH1928> saw<WH7200> that they were defeated<WH5062> by<WH6440> Israel,<WH3478> they made peace<WH7999> with David,<WH1732> and served<WH5647> him:<WH14> neither would the Syrians<WH758> help<WH3467> the children<WH1121> of Ammon any more.<WH5983>
